required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ESPB Combined With Intercostal Nerve Block in VATs
clinical_study.official_title: Erector Spinae Plane Block Combined With Intercostal Nerve Block in Video Assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery: a Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized prospective trial to test the effect of additional Erector Spinae Plane Block (ESPB) with intercostal nerve block during video assisted thoracoscopic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective randomized trial which aims to evaluate effect of peripheral nerve block for pain management, the Erector Spinae Plane Block (ESPB) in patients undergoing video assisted thoracoscopic surgery with intercostal nerve block.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: VAS score (Visual Analog Scale for Pain, 0-10, higher value represent a worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.description: VAS score (Visual Analog Scale for Pain, 0-10, higher value represent a worse outcome)
VAS score (Visual Analog Scale for Pain, 0-10, higher value represent a worse outcome)
VAS score (Visual Analog Scale for Pain, 0-10, higher value represent a worse outcome)
VAS score (Visual Analog Scale for Pain, 0-10, higher value represent a worse outcome)

arm_group.description: Performed ESPB in VATs with intercostal nerve block
Not Performed ESPB in VATs with intercostal nerve block

intervention.description: Erector spinae plane block + Intercostal nerve block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Wedge Resection or Lobectomy under VATS approach.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 20 years
- Patients who has anatomical abnormality in any spine
- Patients who has skin infection near to be the present procedure site
- Intercostal nerve block is not performed during surgery
- Previous lung surgery history of affected side

reference.citation: Chin KJ, Adhikary S, Sarwani N, Forero M. The analgesic efficacy of pre-operative bilateral erector spinae plane (ESP) blocks in patients having ventral hernia repair. Anaesthesia. 2017 Apr;72(4):452-460. doi: 10.1111/anae.13814. Epub 2017 Feb 11.

Forero M, Rajarathinam M, Adhikary S, Chin KJ. Continuous Erector Spinae Plane Block for Rescue Analgesia in Thoracotomy After Epidural Failure: A Case Report. A A Case Rep. 2017 May 15;8(10):254-256. doi: 10.1213/XAA.0000000000000478.

Forero M, Adhikary SD, Lopez H, Tsui C, Chin KJ. The Erector Spinae Plane Block: A Novel Analgesic Technique in Thoracic Neuropathic Pain. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 2016 Sep-Oct;41(5):621-7. doi: 10.1097/AAP.0000000000000451.
Hamilton DL, Manickam B. Erector spinae plane block for pain relief in rib fractures. Br J Anaesth. 2017 Mar 1;118(3):474-475. doi: 10.1093/bja/aex013.

Forero M, Rajarathinam M, Adhikary S, Chin KJ. Erector spinae plane (ESP) block in the management of post thoracotomy pain syndrome: A case series. Scand J Pain. 2017 Oct;17:325-329. doi: 10.1016/j.sjpain.2017.08.013. Epub 2017 Sep 12.
